title: Republish and provide a fresh working shareable link

requirements.text: Publish/deploy the app to a brand-new Internet Computer canister (do not reuse any previous deployment) and provide the user with the new working public URL to share (must be different from https://caffeine.supply/d/3).
acceptanceCriteria: A new deployment is created (brand-new canister / new publish target), not reusing any previous deployment.
A new working URL is produced and shared with the user.
The new URL is different from https://caffeine.supply/d/3.
Opening the new URL in a fresh browser session loads the landing page without network errors (e.g., no 'site cannot be reached', no 'CANISTER ID NOT RESOLVED').

requirements.text: Verify the new deployment supports SPA routing and deep links for both routes "/" and "/celebrate" (including direct navigation and browser refresh) following the checks in frontend/DEPLOYMENT.md.
acceptanceCriteria: Direct navigation to the new deployment URL at "/" loads the landing page.
Direct navigation to the new deployment URL at "/celebrate" loads the celebration page.
Refreshing the browser on "/celebrate" continues to load the celebration page (no blank screen / no 404).
Back/forward navigation works between landing and celebration routes.
Deep-link fallback behavior remains intact (frontend/public/404.html preserves the full URL and frontend/index.html restores it before React mounts).

constraints: Do not reuse the previously shared/unreachable link https://caffeine.supply/d/3; the user needs a fresh, working link.

Frontend files in immutablePaths must not be edited (frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui).
Keep the backend as a single Motoko actor in backend/main.mo; only add migration.mo if a state upgrade is required.
nonGoals: Adding new product features unrelated to generating and sharing a new working deployment link.
Changing app routes or content beyond what is necessary to ensure the deployment and deep-link routing work.
